Description: rectangular robe or coat, with open front, made of 2 loom widths of weft-faced plain weave eau-de-Nil silk, sewn together horizontally; small arm-holes cut at top of side folds. All seams covered with narrow dark gold braid. Both lengths of cloth have int
WebDescription: This sleeveless silk robe or coat would be worn by a man as an overgarment. It has an open front and is made from 2 loom widths of weft-faced plain weave eau-de-Nil silk, sewn together horizontally. Small arm holes have been cut at the top of the side folds. All the seams are covered with narrow dark gold braid. Both lengths of cloth have integral tapestry-woven (discontinuous weft) yellow lines, arranged for final placing so that the largest area of golden yellow is at the centre back top. Such good quality silk was probably woven in Syria.

Description: thick black wool cloth, woven and then felted; edged with red leather; opening at side; pointed "hood" for protection of gun, not head. Worn by a hunter. Weave is visible at hood peak. Neck opening bound and lined with red leather. Joined below this with
WebDescription:
This man's cape, worn by a hunter, is made from thick black wool cloth, woven and then felted. The neck opening is edged with red leather. The body opens at the side, and the pointed "hood" is for protecting a hunter's gun, not his head. The front is simply decorared with v-shaped stitching near the openings, in green alternating with white, orange, yellow and faded red. The red leather binding continues down to the hem. 

The cloak has an interesting history. It was given to some Morecombe guesthouse owners, a Mr and Mrs Jarrett, who befriended members of the Ethiopian royal family when they came to stay in the early 1950s, whilst studying in England. The Jarretts visited Ethiopia, and were given the cloak as a present.

Description: pair of light jute shoes, left/right not differentiated. Sole of thick jute string woven across stiff cores (3 at heel, 4 at ball of foot), narrowing and rising at toe to curled-back peak. Upper finer, warps sewn through sole edge, twined weft; worked in
WebDescription: This pair of shoes are made from jute shoes. The soles are of thick jute string woven across stiff cores, narrowing and rising at the toe to a curled-back peak. The uppers are of finer threads, with warps sewn through the sole edge, and a twined weft worked in rows across the vamp first, ending with the longest row at the side of the heel, then worked up at centre into the triangle that projects over the instep. The heel twining starts at the back, the rows lengthening until they are over the instep. A green line has been inserted around the edges, and there are traces of faded red and green spots on the vamp.

Description: large deep rectangular leather cusion. Base red; sides with 3 black panels and rest red; top has 3 long decorated strips, centre one black, with 3 applique discs of red with smaller green one on top, stitched white, joined by red and white sitching; enclo
WebDescription: Large rectangular leather work cushion from the Jos area with popular geometric designs of appliqu circles and decorative stitching in red, black, white and green. Sold without filling in a local market.

Description: round fan. Central large disc of cardboard, overlaid each side with 3 concentric circles of paper 92nd one stained green); disc of red leather (diam c. 17 cms) at centre, with 4 radiating lines of white/brown/white thongs and 5 roughly cut out shapes (gre
WebDescription: This circular fan is a fairly crude example of combined leather and feather work. The feathers are ostrich feathers, stuck into a central large disc of cardboard, overlaid each side with three concentric circles of paper and an inner circle of red leather. On this inner circle bars, lines and squares of paper and leather have been pasted and stitched to make a crude geometric design. The wooden handle is also covered in red leather. The fan was bought in a local market in the Jos area of the Benue valley in northern Nigeria, and is a fairly high status item for use in an urban household.

Description: large flat square bag, of plain woven natural raffia; supplementary weft float pattern in black on one face, of 2 human figures enclosed by stripes and blocks. Top edges and side seams sewn with black raffia, with black-bound rings at top corners and cent
WebDescription: This large flat square bag is woven from plain raffia fibre with a supplementary weft float pattern in black on one side, of two human figures enclosed by stripes and blocks. The top edges and side seams are sewn with black raffia, with black-bound rings at the top corners and the centre of side seams, and full tassels at the bottom corners. The two handles are made from plaits of black raffia. The bag was bought at a local market in the Jos area of the Benue valley in northern Nigeria.

Description: very large shawl, made of 3 wide strips of cotton (red, blue, red, each width c. 35 cms), bordered on the long edges with 2 narrower blue (5 cm) and red (8cm) strips. Embroidered in centre on wide strips with 3 rectangular stitched blocks set with regular
WebDescription: This very large cotton shawl was worn by a Banjara woman over her blouse and skirt. It is made of 3 wide strips of cotton in alternating red and blue strips, bordered on the long edges with 2 narrower blue and red strips. The is cebtre is embroidered with 3 rectangular stitched blocks set with a regular pattern of large mirrors outlined in red button-holing. The stitching is done in yellow on the red cloth, and red on the blue cloth. The seams have 2 applique lines of scalloped white cloth, and stitching. The bordres have 2 similar lines of scalloped applique, and 2 lines of stitched running diamonds.

Description: long narrow rectangle of cotton cloth, red and white print backed with white; heavily embroidered and set with 2 rows of 26 mirrors, stitched mainly in red and blue, with some yellow, white and green. Along one long edge are sewn 49 small soft grey metal
WebDescription: Mirrored shawl edging, similar to the othe Banjara pieces, with large pieces of mirror on a background of different coloured rectangles of cotton.

Description: open-backed blouse, pieced from 4 rectangular embroidered panels and 4 long strips (2 red, 2 blue). Embroidered front T-shaped; red and blue strips are sewn up each side around the angles, folding forward to make arm-holes, ends sewn to top of T each side
WebDescription: This blouse was made in a T shape, with sleeves and a piece of fabric which would cover the front of the body.  It would be fastened around the back using fabric ties.  A simple slash at the top forms the neck opening.  It would be worn with a large shawl which would cover the head and back of the wearer.  It is decorated with embroidery and appliqued decoration.

Description: skirt with deep waist band (h=13.5cm, w=80 cm), densely embroidred, mainly in buttonhole, chain and couching stitches, in dark red, green, yellow, white and black. Body of skirt gathered into waistband is made up of wide horizontal bands different coloure
WebDescription: Shirt with deep embroidered waistband, and main body a sries of different coloured bands from waist to hem. All embroidered in applique. The stitches used include button-hole and couching.

Description: flat bag, folded piece of red felt, a horse-saddle side bag. Straight open top, base tapering to rounded point. Embroidered all over with bnads of black plaited sittch outlined in white chain stitch (c. 1.5 cm wide) different designs on each face, but sim
WebDescription: This flat bag is a horse-saddle side bag. It has been made from a folded piece of red felt with a straight open top, and a rounded point at the base. It is embroidered all over with bands of black plaited sittch outlined in white chain stitch. The designs are slightly different on the bag front and back, but made from similar elements of curling hooks. The felt is stitched to a lining of handwoven plain weave wool cloth, with a pattern of red, blue and yellow stripes. Near the opening is a facing of grey wool cloth, and a tablet weave band. The bottom seams are overstitched and decorated with horse or goat hair tassels.

Description: man's robe of dark yellow silk damask, patterned with large stylised Chinese character (long life?) and scrolling foliage. Body flared, left side folds over right. Band of padded and quilted brocade (yellow with red and blue) around neck, below black velv
WebDescription: This Mongolian man's robe is made from a yellow silk damask, woven with a pattern of scroling foliage and a large stylised Chinese character (meaning long life). The cloth was imported from China, and the robe may have been made up there too. The robe crosses over at the front, left over right, and the body is flared. The horse-shoe shaped cuffs and the neck band are of black silk velvet, lined with blue silk damask. The rest of the robe is lined with coarse red and blue cotton. The sleeve ends have bands of padded quilting, and the neck has a narrow band of quilted and padded brocade.

Description: fez cap for man, almost cylindrical red felted cloth cap; flat top with long black yarn tassel attached at centre. Inside top lined with brown damask, sides with finely woven grass, rim faced with broad red, blue and white ribbon. Manufacturer's label ins
WebDescription: This is a good example of a man's 'Fez' cap, widespread throughout northern Africa and Turkey from the end of the 19th century. It is almost cylindrical and made of felted red wool cloth with a flat top that has a long black yarn tassel attached at the centre. Inside the top is lined with brown damask and the sides with finely woven grass or plant fibre. The rim is faced with broad red, blue and white silk ribbon. The manufacturer's or shop label is still intact on the inside top. It reads: 'Naga Freres, Place Mohamed Aly no. 13, Alexandrie', and more in Arabic script.

Description: Shap-pe's jacket, short with very long sleeves, body and upper arms of mustard coloured brocade with multicoloured clouds, one dragon on right front and five dragons on back. Lower sleeve  has brocade bands, cuffs embroidered with bands of running frets,
WebDescription: This luxurious jacket would have been worn by a Shap-pe, a secular leader, such as a cabinet minister or diplomat. It incorporates many of the same fine silk brocades and damasks used to mount the religious Thang-ka paintings, which are imported from China. The designs include multi-coloured clouds and dragons. Purchased from Joshua Graham, 1984

Description: Shap-pe's jacket, short with very long sleeves, body and upper arms of mustard coloured brocade with multicoloured clouds, one dragon on right front and five dragons on back. Lower sleeve  has brocade bands, cuffs embroidered with bands of running frets,
WebDescription: This luxurious jacket would be worn by a Shap-pe, a secular leader. It incorporates many of the same fine silk brocades used to mount the religious Thang-ka paintings. These are imported from China. The main body of the jacket is made from a yellow ground brocade, and the long sleeves from panels of blue, cream, red and green brocades. Both the front opening and the cuffs are edged with black silk velvet and a broad brocade band with a running key fret design on a pale orange ground. The main body brocade includes designs of multicoloured clouds, one dragon front right and five dragons on the back. The jacket is lined with turquoise blue silk damask, faced at the collar and front opening with red damask.

Description: woman's blouse, traditionally cut, in rose red cotton (faded), interlined and then lined with coarser apricot cotton cloth. Machine-stitched quilting, vertical bands of pattern: parallel lines merging into variable wavy lines and back to parallel, alterna
WebDescription: This traditionally cut woman's blouse in rose red cotton (now faded), has been interlined and then lined with a coarser apricot cotton cloth. It has machine-stitched quilting and vertical bands of pattern: parallel lines merging into variable wavy lines and back to parallel, alternating with rosettes and lanceolate leaves with trailing curves (rather like a shooting star). The stand-up collar is lined with white cotton and the blouse fastens right over left in a curve down the front, with cloth ties.

Description: long narrow (loom-width) wool cloth, twill weave, slightly felted. Black, with alternating pattern of 4 blue-grey weft bands (cotton?) and line of 3 tie-dyed motifs, red circle with black quatrefoil at centre; pattern repeat c. 14 cms. At each end, narrow
WebDescription: This long narrow belt cloth was woven on a narrow loom in a twill weave which has been slightly felted. Some cotton is woven with the wool. Black and grey stripes alternate with a line of 3 tie-dyed motifs, of a red circle with a black quatrefoil at the centre. Each end, has a long piled fringe dyed in bands  of red, black, green, red, deep violet and black.

Description: one of 3 cloths or blankets, strip-woven. This one of 5 strips, 20-25 cms wide. Warp of white cotton; weft of white cotton; black, chestnut and yellow ochure wool/hair. Pattern each end of weft-faced bands, 2.5 cms deep, in symmetrical repeating design se
WebDescription: This cotton blanket is made from 3 narrower strips hand-woven locally and sewn together. The warps are of white cotton and the wefts of white cotton and black, chestnut and yellow ochre dyed wool woven in a design of horizontally striped bands. Such 'country' cloths are usually woven and traded in northern areas of West African countries, just south of the Sahara, by a variety of peoples, including the Hausa and Fulani.

Description: one of a set of 7 small samples of cloth, showing stages of the batik process.
WebDescription: These small samples of cloth demonstrate the stages in the batik process, from the first printing of wax resist with a copper block to the final dyeing and removal of all the wax resist layers.

Description: woman's sarong, with pattern in brown, blue and yellow.
WebDescription: Woman's sarong of cotton, with a design made in batik, a wax and dye-resist technique. The pattern is of contrasting floral panels and diagonal bands in brown, blue and yellow.

Description: red, yellow and gold print jacket or blouse. Part of costume set for a woman, F.1987.9.10-16. Goes with long red skirt also printed with gold. Very short to match high waist of the latter. Ribbon ties at front. Collar stands up at back of neck only.
WebDescription: This red, yellow and gold print jacket or blouse is part of costume set for a woman. It has a low stand-up collar that continues as a lapel decoration down the front, and the jacket is tied high above the waist with ribbon ties. Here it is worn with a long red silk skirt, printed with gold.

Description:
one of a pair of shoes for a woman, called Gomusin ???, white rubber with red rims and toe tips, and banded decoration near white soles. Printed interiors with maker's marks, figures and size.

(Written by Myunghae Seo 05.Jan.2015)
On the shoes at the
WebDescription: These painted rubber shoes are worn by Korean women. The top edges and toes are painted red, and the bottom has a more complex striped decoration, and a rondel with a manufacturer's mark. Other maker's stamps are printed inside.

Description:
one of a pair of socks for a baby, for their 1st birthday.  White cotton, with quilted vertical ribbing. Blue silk ribbon across ankles. Red, green and yellow floral embroidery, with red tassel on top of foot.

(Written by Myunghae Seo 07.JAN.2015)
A p
WebDescription: These tiny socks are gifts for a baby on its first birthday. They are made of quilted white cotton, with floral embroidery and a blue satin ribbon for ornament.

Description: plastic boy doll, with green velvet bonnet that has gilt thistle badge and red plush pompom. Body has blonde coloured artificial hair, and eyes that close, red rosebud lips. Wears red tartan 'kilt' of cotton with green waistband, a similar tartan shawl ov
WebDescription: Plastic boy doll in Scots dress, with a green velvet bonnet that has a gilt thistle badge and a red plush pompom. The boy has blonde coloured artificial hair, eyes that close, and red rosebud lips. He wears a red tartan 'kilt' of cotton with a green waistband, a similar tartan shawl over his left shoulder, a green velvet jacket with white lace cuffs, and a rabbit patterned polyester shirt front, with a lace ruffle down the centre. He has red plastic shoes on feet and underpants of the same rabbit patterned polyester cotton as his shirt front. What a cheerful little souvenir he makes!

Description: blue silk damasc hat with black and white fur trim. Worn by women in winter.  Main hood-like exterior has black fur trim round front edge, and red silk tassel at back with ribbon coming to front top, with another tassel there. Gap at top, possibly to allo
WebDescription: This woman's hat or hood is made of deep blue silk damask, trimmed with both black and white fur. The white fur edges the side flaps tucked under the main hood. The top of the hood is open, so a small amount of the wearer's hair would peep through. The red silk braid that ends in a smaller tassel at the front, and a larger tassel behind, would cross over the wearer's hair. Sir F.H. May collected this hat in Korea in 1916.

Description: pink and grey silk sari length with gold brocading. Benares style.
WebDescription: This is a very fine ladies sari of diaphanous pink and grey hued silk woven with gold thread brocading of regular floral sprays, a broad border all round, and a very deep border at the palu or shawl end, with a more complex design of repeated floral lobes. It was probably woven in Varanasi (formerly Benares) in northern India.

Description: Red velvet conical cloth cap with black band of floral beadwork as border edge, and small circle of pearl coloured beads at tip. Lined with pink cotton or cambric.
WebDescription: This conical cap is made of red velvet, with a broad band of floral beadwork as a border edge, and a small circle of pearl coloured beads at the top. The larger areas of the glass beadwork designs have been sewn onto paper templates first. The cap is lined with pink cotton or cambric, and the bottom edge is trimmed with pink silk ribbon, now badly worn. This is one of several beaded cap styles for men found in the Great Lakes and Maritime Provinces areas of Canada. It would be worn either lower down over the forehead, with the top upwards, or with this extra height folded over to one side. All the sewing and beadwork was done by women. The floral designs were first introduced in sewing classes run by French nuns in the early and mid eighteenth century.

Description: woman's cloth wrapper of factory-woven cotton cloth, indigo-dyed; cassava paste resist, freehand painting. Known as "Adire" cloth, made of 2 widths industrially woven sheeting, machine stitched. Called Adire Eleko. Chequer board design, with some all-over
WebDescription: This woman's cloth wrapper is made from industrially woven cotton sheeting, two widths of which have been machine stitched together. The cloth has been dyed locally with a resist design using indigo-dye and a cassava paste resist which is applied by freehand painting before dyeing. It is a type of cloth known as 'Adire Eleko'. The design is like a chequer board, with some all-over patterns and some large motifs.

Description: factory cloth, indigo-dyed; stencilled cassava-paste resist in "Jubilee" design. 2 widths of industrially woven cotton cloth, with damask pattern. Ends not hemmed. Dyed indigo with stencilled paste-resist pattern. Centre seam machine-stitched after dyeing
WebDescription: This is another industrially woven cotton cloth which has been indigo-dyed with stencilled cassava-paste resist designs. Two widths of factory woven cotton damask are stitched together, the ends unhemmed.  The crowded motifs include people, objects, flowers and inscriptions. This sort of Adire Eleko is known as 'Jubilee cloth' because the crowned couple, in the large central ovals, are similar to earlier designs made to celebrate the Royal Jubilee of King George and Queen Mary in 1935. The inscription along the selvedges includes the names and initials: Aralamo.Akomo.Nu.Won.BP.Iku.Ile.o.Sitode.o.Pa.Ni.

Description: woman's cloth wrapper of factory-woven cotton cloth, indigo-dyed; stitched resist. 2 widths of industrially woven sheeting; machine-stitched and hemmed. Tie-dyed and stitch resist patterns (many lines of stitching not removed). Wide herring-bone and (x) p
WebDescription: This woman's cloth wrapper is made of industrially woven cotton sheeting, indigo-dyed with a tie-dyed and stitched resist design. Many of the lines of stitching have not been removed. The design is a contrast of wide herring-bone and 'x' pattern bands. It is called Adire Oniko Alabere.

Description: panel of raffia cloth, from longer dance skirt; applique pattern of strips and small pieces, random and non-linear. Stitched and hemmed with dark brown fibre. 5 small brown bobbles at 2 ends (2 others missing). Ends appear to have been unsewn ? from longe
WebDescription: This panel of raffia cloth has been cut from a longer dance skirt. It has a complex applique pattern of strips and small pieces, which is random and non-linear. It has been stitched and hemmed with dark brown fibre and there are 5 small brown bobbles at 2 ends (2 others are now missing). This sort of cloth was worn by dancers and courtiers amongst the Shoowa people in the late 19th century, and some local makers continued making smaller lengths for sale into the 20th century.

Description: woman's robe, called a KIRA, blue ground with many other colours, woven design. Rectangular, made of 3 lengths of blue warp-faced plain-weave cotton, with red/yellow/green stripes at sides. Single-face supplementary weft patterns, multi-coloured.
WebDescription: The Bhutanese woman's robe or Kira is a long rectangular cotton brocade, usually wrapped round as a skirt. It is worn with a jacket, blouse and scarf. This kira is made up of  3 lengths of blue warp-faced plain-weave cotton with complex multi-coloured single-face supplementary weft designs. The cloth has red, yellow and green stripes at the sides.

Description: man's GHO or robe, of red and orange check design, woven. Fine woollen twill broadcloth, dark red with checks of black/yellow approximately 3 cms square. Lined with blue cotton with white/black/red check facing. Left front ties at right side.
WebDescription: This man's robe is called a Gho. It is made from a finely woven woollen broadcloth with a red and orange check design, woven in a twill weave. The robe is lined with blue cotton with a white, black and red check facing. The left front ties over the right side.  The robe is worn  with a waist band so that the length can be folded up to the right size for the wearer, a white cotton undershirt with broad cuffs, and a long white cotton scarf.

Description: black yak hair hat, felted. Shaped like a disc, edge turning under, with 5 "tails" (drip-tips). As worn by Biogpa shepherds of east Bhutan.
WebDescription: This disc shaped cap is made of densely felted black yak hair. It is turned under at the edge and  has 5 "tails" acting as drip-tips (two can be seen in the photograph). It is worn by Biogpa shepherds of east Bhutan.

Description: tipi made circa 1920s, of canvas, painted with warrior figures. Some minor repair work to the canvas, down the front between the lacing pins done by vendor. Came with lining (F.1989.4.2) which is not Indian made. Poles were not supplied.
WebDescription: Tipi or tent lining cloth of thick cotton canvas painted with images of warriors on horseback holding lances or spears.

Description: man's cap of knitted wool, multicoloured with triangle pattern. Main colours blue, yellow, orange, green and white. Conical with small tuft at peak.
WebDescription: This is a man's cap of hand-knitted wool, multicoloured with a triangle pattern. The main colours are blue, yellow, orange, green and white. There is a small tuft left during finishing off at the peak.  This is very everyday headwear worn during cold nights and winters.

Description: plastic lady doll, with machine stitched cloth label: a Chiquita Doll, from Nassau. Orange check scarf topped by hat or basket with fruit and flowers including two large plastic bananas. She wears dress with large circular skirt, the back of the skirt ras
WebDescription: Chiquita Bahamas doll. Plastic doll with eyes that shut when she is laid down, wearing a basket of flowers and Chiquita bananas on her head. Her large circular skirt of different coloured cotton strips flares up behind her. She also wears a lacy apron and blouse. The design is based on a market-woman's outfit, transformed for carnival wear.

Description: doll of stuffed brown cotton cloth, with embroidered face and check scarf tied round head. Transparent plastic bead earrings. Second check scarf on shoulders, white cotton dress with multicoloured overskirt. St Lucia embroidered in red chain stitch bottom
WebDescription: Home-made cloth doll with hand-stitched face and black wool hair. She wears one check scarf tied round her head and another on her shoulders. She has transparent plastic bead earrings and a white cotton dress with a multicoloured overskirt. St Lucia is embroidered in red chain stitch on the front of her dress.

Description: doll made of banana leaves and other vegetable fibres with printed paper label tied on: 'I come from Bermuda, the "Isles of Sunshine", I'm dressed in banana and native screw pine'. Lady with large tiered skirt, carrying basket on right, parasol on left, w
WebDescription: Local products doll with a message on her label:  'I come from Bermuda, the "Isles of Sunshine". I'm dressed in banana and native screw pine'. Banana leaves make up her tiered skirt, and pine fibre has been used to knit her shawl, and cut and pressed for her hat. She carries a very ladylike small basket and parasol.

Description: brown clay male doll or figure ornament, wearing wide brimmed straw hat, red cotton shirt and blue cotton trousers. With clay drum on string round neck. Hands positioned as if beating drum. Feet painted white and black for shoes. Shirt attached by a nail,
WebDescription: One of two clay figures of a drummer and a guitar player, representing the lively musical culture of Jamaica. This one carries a straw bag over his shoulders as well as wearing a large straw hat on his head. A cheap souvenir ornament for display on your mantel piece at home.

Description: brown clay male doll or figure ornament, wearing wide brimmed straw hat, yellow cotton shirt and red cotton trousers. With clay guitar held on chest. Hands positioned as if strumming. Feet painted white and black for shoes. Shirt attached by a nail, trous
WebDescription: One of two clay figures of a drummer and a guitar player, representing the lively musical culture of Jamaica. They wear straw hats and cotton shirts and trousers. Souvenir ornaments for display on your mantel piece at home.

Description: male figure or doll wearing large brimmed white hat, and the black trousers and jacket of a mariarche musician. Brown plush holster round waist, plastic gun (silvery), striped green serape or shawl over outstretched left arm. Circular transparent plastic
WebDescription: Male costume doll wearing a typical sombrero or large brimmed white hat, and the black trousers and jacket of a mariarche musician. This plastic doll has a brown plush holster round his waist, containing a silver coloured plastic gun. Over his shoulder and left arm is a striped green serape or shawl.

Description: male figure or doll in the costume of a horseman or gaucho. Painted clay head, black hair, black hat. Cream cloth shirt, black waistcoat, blue neck tie, red shawl or serape over left shoulder. Brown belt, plastic imitating leather, with model bolas attach
WebDescription: Male doll in the costume of a horseman or gaucho. He has a painted clay head, black hair and a black hat. He wears a long red shawl or serape over his left shoulder, a cream cloth shirt, black waistcoat, and blue neck tie. His brown plastic belt imitates a leather original and has a model bolas attached. His black riding trousers and lacy leggings end in brown boots.

Description: seated man playing wooden pipe, 'snake-charmer'. Wears white cotton trousers, striped white cotton shirt, brown cotton waistcoat and red cotton turban. Stuffed cotton cloth, probably with wire support inside. Pale beige colour with black inked beard, eyeb
WebDescription: Snake-charmer doll or figure, India, 1980s. Hand-made for sale as a souvenir to tourists. This turbanned bearded man wears white cotton trousers, a striped white cotton shirt and a brown cotton waistcoat. His body is made of stuffed cotton cloth, his face is a pale beige colour with black inked beard, eyebrows, eyes and moustache, and red lips. He sits with his feet tucked under him, and plays his wooden flute, to make the clay snake rise out of its basket in front of him.

Description: standing female doll on large lacquered wood base, rectangular. Orange and gold silk brocade kimono, starched cream, black and gold obi, with red silk tie. Black silk thread hair do with plastic and foil combs, pins and ties. Gold paper fan in raised righ
WebDescription: This costume doll is of a well-dressed Japanese lady wearing a silk brocade kimono with a chrysanthemum pattern of orange, pink and gold. It has a trailing hem. The lining is a cream damask. Her tabi socks peep out in front. She has tiny shell, foil and bead hair ornaments in her black silk thread hair, and once held a small model fan. Her obi or waist belt is of starched cream cloth with a woven geometric design in black and gold, and a red silk tie.

Description: boy doll, plastic, in black wool tunic with red and brown wool trim and black imitation leather belt. Pale brown suede boots, red wool boot ties, black cotton trousers, Fur-trimmed squarish cap with beadwork panel on front, black and red wool cloth with w
WebDescription: These souvenir dolls show the traditional costume that the Sami still wear for important cultural celebrations. The Sami (formerly known as the Lapp) have campaigned hard to keep their ancient culture alive in the far north of Norway, Sweden and Finland.

Description: doll or figure, a woman carrying a gourd of peanuts on her head. Made of brown nylown brush fabric stuffed over wire base, the thick wire protruding behind her feet to make a stand to keep her upright. She wears printed cotton skirt and body wrap, and hea
WebDescription: Woman carrying a gourd on her head, with peanuts inside. She wears a brown and black cotton print outfit with a headwrap, and carries a baby on her back. This doll or ornamental figure captures the contemporary costume of Gambian women, and shows some of their traditional roles, as carriers and sellers of everyday foods. Her body is made of wire wrapped in brown brush nylong, and her facial features are embroidered. Donated by Dr M Shackleton, 1989.

Description: girl doll in tall red wool cap with beadwork on front, and printed cotton scarf tied on. Red cotton jackect with beadwork waist band. Printed cotton skirt, striped blue white and purple. Pointed pale leather boos with red and yellow wool boot ties, White
WebDescription: These souvenir dolls show the traditional costume that the Sami still wear for important cultural celebrations. The Sami (formerly known as the Lapp) have campaigned hard to keep their ancient culture alive in the far north of Norway, Sweden and Finland.

Description: dried apple faced doll in yellow souwester hat, anorak and trousers, carrying basket of shells in front. Wears white wool gloves and black and white wool socks. Gilt wire frame glasses, sheeps wool hair. Makers label booklet attached 'Suttles and Seawinds
WebDescription: Apple headed fisherman doll, Nova Scotia, Canada, 1980s. Made by Olive Pearl on Tancock island, for sale as a 'Heritage Craft' item and described as a 'Native Apple Doll' (on the large booklet label). The fisherman wears a yellow souwester hat, anorak and trousers, and carries a basket of shells. He also wears white wool gloves and black and white wool socks. He has gilt wire frame glasses, and sheeps wool hair.

Description: Plastic doll wearing North West Coast costume. Red wool head band with sequin ornament. Twist of cedar bark tied round shoulders. Long black hair. Eyes open and close. Red and black cloth cloak with bell and sequin decoration. Pink dress, black wool apron
WebDescription: Kwaila costume doll, North West Coast area, Canada, 1980s. A plastic doll dressed in traditional costume with a red wool head band with sequin ornament, a twist of cedar bark tied round her shoulders and long black hair. Her eyes open and close. She wears a red and black cloth cloak with bell and sequin decoration over a pink dress. Her black wool apron has the outline design of a 'copper' in purple sequins and beads, and three bells at bottom. A similar 'copper' design is featured on the back of her cloak.

Description: stone headed Inuit doll, wearing white blanket cloth parka with black wool trim on hood, navy blue cotton trousers with braid and embroidery on lower legs. Pale cream leather moccasins with red and blue wool stitching. Mittens of green cotton. Very stocky
WebDescription: Stone headed Inuit doll, made for sale to tourists, Canada, 1980s. Many Inuit became professional stone carvers to make a living from craft and art sales from the 1960s onwards. This doll wears a white blanket cloth parka with black wool trim on the hood, and navy blue cotton trousers with braid and embroidery on the lower legs. He has pale cream leather moccasins with red and blue wool stitching and mittens of green cotton. The doll is very stocky, and firmly padded out.

Description: male figure or doll representing a Canadian voyageur or trapper, wears fur hat, pale brown felt jacket with collar and shoulder fringe, matching trousers and boots. Carries artificial flece over left arm. Wears fur mittens and multicoloured braid waistban
WebDescription: Trapper figure doll, 1980s, with maker's label: Handcrafted in Canada, in the home of Ruth Irene Davis. This bearded man represents a Canadian voyageur or trapper. He wears a fur hat, a pale brown felt jacket with collar and shoulder fringes, and matching trousers and boots. He carries a fleece (this one is artificial) over his left arm and wears fur mittens and a multicoloured braided waistband over his jacket.

Description: Figure of False Face Society masked dancer, on wooden plinth, holding birch bark rattle in right hand and stick in left. Kneeling with red head cloth and grey and red mask. Limbs of corn husk, also wears suede tunic with red inked design and multicoloured
WebDescription: Figure of a False Face Society masked dancer of the Iroquois people of the Great Lakes area of Canada, 1980s. He holds a birch bark rattle in his right hand and wears a red head cloth and a grey and red mask. He also wears a suede tunic with red inked design and multicoloured wool ties round the waist and knees. His limbs are made of corn husk.  The makers label reads: Iroqrafts, Iroquois corn husk doll, made by Owa'nyudane and Dohandra. This corn husk doll represents Keel Nose Mask.

Description: female plastic doll representing a Paris cancan dancer. On black circular plastic base, right leg in the air, revealing lacy underskirt with pink bows. Red skirt shows at back with black lace trim. Black lace bodice. Hair in bun with large orange feather
WebDescription: This plastic doll represents a Paris cancan dancer with a large orange feather headdress. Her right leg is kicked up, as in the cancan dance, revealing a lacy underskirt with pink bows. Her outfit is a black lace bodice and a red skirt with black lace trim. Her eyes open and shut. Her left leg is fixed to the black plastic base. She was made for sale as a souvenir, for display on a mantel-piece or shelf. Feather headdresses and boas were very popular in Europe in Edwardian times, but are now only found associated with nostalgic theatre or dance dress.

Description: Part of Mandarin's outfit, F.1989.14.4.A-H. Dragon robe or coat of orange/red satin, some wear and moth damage. Some of the stitching of the metal thread embroidery is loose. Has been used for fancy dress. Good quality. Valery Garrett 7/8/08: Definitely a
WebDescription: This embroidered orange silk robe is part of a mandarin or official's outfit. It was collected in China, but has since been slightly altered for fancy dress wear. The body of the robe features many of the traditional celestial symbols, including diagonal stripes at the hem representing water with waves and a central mountain peak, peonies done in Peking knot stitch, 10 dragons of couched gold thread, and clouds and flaming pearls in satin stitch. The sleeves are very wide and long.

Description: Very heavy raffia slipper with very heavy sole. Lined and edged with fur. Made in Belgium, World War II?
WebDescription: These sturdy and warm rustic shoes are made of plaited straw or raffia, trimmed and lined with rabbit fur. The soles are protected by leather. They are unworn, and were probably collected new as a novelty gift or souvenir, from a small town cobbler or market stall.

Description: One of a pair of tooled leather shoes with applied leather decoration.
WebDescription: This pair of soft leather sandals for a man are decorated with applied and tooled designs. The dark brown body has diagonal tooled lines, and circles and triangle designs are applied by overstitching in contrasting tan and red leather. They are slip on sandals with a thin but harder leather sole, broad fronts and large tongues.

Description: one of a pair of small wooden shoes, Louis heel, very pointed toe. Leather and fur trimmed.
WebDescription: This pair of small wooden shoes for a child have very pointed toes (now chipped), and Louis heels, a style of narrow curved heel that gets its name from French court shoes. They are trimmed with leather, fur (probably rabbit fur), and cotton lace. They may be from Western Europe, or from Turkey, where many French shoes were imported, and copied. They are probably best shoes for a small girl.

Description: one of a pair of flat wooden soles, called 'chaples', raised both ends (like clogs), with upper inlaid in ivory. Very high rod with decorated knob between the toes.
WebDescription: Pair of wooden sandals, called 'chappels.' The flat soles are raised on curved supports at the toe and heel ends, and the tall toe grips are formed by waisted rods with an ivory or bone flower head on top. The upper surfaces are decorated with fine inlays of ivory or bone in a floral design.

Description: one of a pair of flat wooden soles, called 'chaples', raised both ends (like clogs), with upper inlaid in ivory. Very high rod with decorated knob between the toes.
WebDescription:
Raised wooden sandals called chappals, with floral ivory inlays. India, c. 1900
Transferred from Worthing Museum and Art Gallery, 1989.

Description: cream wool cape, with large hood, light grey blue silk braid edging and tassel. Ulrike al-Khamis (NMS) 29/9/2005: For a man. Very typical Moroccan garment, c. 1960. Also known as burnus or burnous.
WebDescription: This man's cape of cream wool cloth has a large hood with a tassel and light grey blue silk braid edging round the neck opening. It is a very typical Moroccan garment, known as a burnos, burnus or burnous.

Description: caftan like robe of black velvet with round slashed neck, and long sleeves. Decorated with chain stitch embroidery in scarlet, orange, green and gilt gold. For a woman? Width at hem 830 mm.
WebDescription: This caftan like robe for a woman of black silk velvet has a round slashed neck, and long sleeves. The front chest area, shoulders, centre back, sleeve ends and robe sides are densely embroidered with geometric designs in chain stitch, in scarlet, orange, and green silk threads with some gilt or gold details. It is one of several Moroccan outfits originally collected by Mr Paul Getty Jnr, in the 1960s.

Description: brown suede with applied and embroidered decoration on collar, shoulder, cuffs, front and hem, false pockets. Embroidery in blue, turquoise, black and yellow. Scalloped fringing, embossed or cut decoration as well. Motif at centreback of double headed bir
WebDescription: This brown suede coat for a man is said to have been bought in Morocco, but may have been made in Spain, Germany or even Mexico. The collar, shoulder trims, cuffs, front and hem have been decorated by pinking, cutting, tooling, appliqu, embroidery and ribbon trim. The embroidery, in satin stitch, is in blue, turquoise, yellow and black silk thread. A large embroidered double-headed eagle motif has been applied centre back, and there are mask designs on the shoulders. The remaining brass button, front top right, has a stamped design of a stags head. This suggests the coat was made as a hunting or riding coat. This is one of several items originally collected by Mr Paul Getty Jnr, in the 1960s.

Description: one of a pair of 'Arabian' curtains, purchased at Wembley in 1924. Embroidered with chain stitch machine?. Definitely from Iran, the embroidered signature in pear-shaped cartouche near centre top is in Farsi (Persian - confirmed by comments from Leeds Ira
WebDescription:
This curtain is one of a pair with a central panel of red linen or cotton fabric and a wide grey border. The central panel is embroidered with a picture of a king sitting on a throne, surrounded by fan bearers and courtiers.  The embroidered border depicts hunting scenes.  Brightly coloured yarns have been used for the embroidery, which is done using chain stitch.

An inscription is embroidered at the top of the red central panel.  This reads 'Faridoun' and is written in Farsi.  Faridoun was the name of a heroic Ancient Persian king who is featured in the poem 'Shahnameh', or 'The Epic of Kings', which contains many hero tales from Ancient Persia.  Faridoun was often depicted in Iranian scenes dating from the late nineteenth and early twentieth century, on ceramics as well as textiles.

Description: length of tapa or barkcloth, made into a tunic, mid 19th century. Open at sides with fringed eges. Neck line sewn with blue and white cotton binding. Brown on cream painted design of lentoid curves and darker diagonal lines, inside rectangles. The darker
WebDescription: This tunic or poncho is made from a length of tapa or barkcloth, produced by beating inner bark layers of the bread fruit tree. The tunic is open at the sides, which have been cut to make a fringe. The gently curved neck line is reinforced with blue and white cotton binding. The barkcloth is painted with a design of pale brown curves and darker diagonal lines inside rectangles. The darker lines are quite resinous.

Description: blouse of cream linen, pre 1900?, with embroidered front and sleeve ends - in red and blue cross stitch. High neckband. Has been widened and lengthened later and press stud fastening added. For a man?, Leningrad district.
WebDescription: This linen blouse may be for a man rather than a woman. It has a high neck line and is embroidered with cross-stitch bands in blue and red cotton thread. Close examination shows that it has been widened and lengthened sometime during use, and a metal press stud fastening has been added.

Description: robe of handwoven natural linen, sleeves woven with bands of red and with red material let in at shoulders and wrists. Some embroidery. Neck outlined with embroidery and sequins. Part of woman's costume, A-F. Width at hem 714mm.
WebDescription: This robe of handwoven linen is part of a woman's costume set which includes an overskirt, an apron, a headdress, a belt and a neckband. The sleeves are woven with bands of red, and red material has also been let in at the shoulders and wrists. The neck is outlined with embroidery and sequins, and the hem is decorated with a band of pale red silk ribbon. The rest of the robe is plain as it is worn underneath all the other layers.

Description: handwoven material in black and red with inlet vertical strips of red material, green gauze ribbon, gold tinsel ribbon and bands of blue, red, green and orange wool embroidery. The hem is treated in the same manner horizontally. Has been enlarged by an in
WebDescription: This overskirt is worn on top of the robe. It is of handwoven linen or wool, mainly red with a central black band and with inset vertical strips of red material, green gauze ribbon, gold tinsel ribbon and bands of blue, red, green and orange wool embroidery. The hem is treated in the same manner horizontally. The skirt has been enlarged by an inset of material at later date.

Description: natural linen apron with woven design in red. Horizontal bands of red cloth and black braid at hem with narrow fill of red and yellow early printed cotton. Embroidered yoke armholes in red. Tied at back and underarms with scarlet, stain ribbon. Part of a
WebDescription: This linen apron is woven in cream or white with designs in red. The hem has additional horizontal bands of red cloth and black braid, with a narrow fill of red and yellow early printed cotton. The yoke armholes are embroidered in red. The apron is tied at the back and underarms with a scarlet satin ribbon.

Description: belt of black and red woven wool with fringed ends. Part of a woman's costume, A-F.
WebDescription: This belt of black and red woven wool has fringed ends. It is part of the six piece woman's costume set.

Description: bright pink cloth with bead ornamentation at front and heavy bead fringe at the back. Crystal beads and red wool tufts and multicolour silk ribbons hand down each side. Part of a woman's costume, A-F.
WebDescription: This elaborate headdress is part of a six piece woman's costume set. The bright pink polyester silk cap has crudely curled wire inside to make the forehead area stand up. Across the forehead on front is a broad band of glass beadwork, with wool tufts below.  At the back is a heavy bead fringe and at the sides are long lengths of silk ribbon.

Description: beaded band, worn as a necklace. Part of a woman's costume, A-F.
WebDescription: This narrow beaded band is worn as a necklace with the rest of the six part woman's costume. It has fringed ends and a pattern of repeated rectangular panels with a wide variety of designs including chevrons and diamonds.

Description: purple silk robe or coat. Cut in one piece with seam along shoulders and side openings for arms. Open down centre-front. Ornamental pattern woven in gold. For a man.
WebDescription: This man's robe or coat of purple silk was woven in one piece with a seam along shoulders and upper side openings for arms. It has a wide opening down the centre front. A gold thread pattern has been woven in, especially at the centre back.

Description: blue satin tunic, neck and front edged with red satin. Heavily embroidered down front, across shoulders and lower hem in white, red and yellow. Also an all over pattern of small flowers.
WebDescription: This woman's blue satin tunic is heavily embroidered in satin stitch down the front, across the shoulders and along the lower hem with a floral pattern in white, red and yellow silk thread. The rest of the tunic has an all over pattern of small flowers. The neck and front are edged with red satin.

Description: blue and white/silver brocade jacket. Inner sleeve edges finished with pink satin. Neck and front decorated with yellow metallic braid and silver metallic twisted and coiled motifs. Slashed sides.
WebDescription: This jacket of woven blue and white or silver brocade would have been worn by a wealthy man. The inner sleeve edges and the hem are finished with pink satin. The neck and front are decorated with gold braid and and silver thread twists, couched down. The side seams are open at the bottom. The front seams and sleeve edges are covered with a narrow black and yellow braid.

Description: magenta velvet caftan robe, with gilt thread embroidery, tassel and button ornaments and fringed braid at shoulders. Cotton lining. Ulrike al-Khamis (NMS) 29/9/2005: For a woman or young girl, has an obvious waist and is quite short. It would have had to
WebDescription: This striking woman's robe or caftan is made of magenta silk velvet richly decorated with gold thread embroidery, tassels and button ornaments and fringed braid at the shoulders. It has an obvious waist and is fairly short so it must be for a young woman or a girl. The shoulder fringes and tasseled buttons are a fashionable feature copied from French military uniforms of the period.

Description: baggy trousers, of pale blue satin. With heavy gold thread embroidery. Drawstring waist. Cotton lining. Worn in places. Part of a five-piece outfit for a woman, possibly made for the European market, late 19th or early 20th century.
WebDescription: Shown here with its matching jacket and waistcoat are a pair of baggy trousers, of pale blue satin, with heavy gold thread embroidery. The waist is gathered by a drawstring tied through an interior casing. The trousers are lined with white cotton. The embroidery is concentrated down the outsides of the legs, and the ankles. The trousers are one item from a well-made fashionable five-piece outfit for a wealthy woman for town or court wear.

Description:
pale blue satin cap, matching trousers 1968/83, with gold thread embroidery and gold thread tassle attached to centre of crown. Part of woman's five part outfit, A-E.
Ulrike al-Khamis (NMS 29/9/2005): front of hat has star above crescent design for Turke
WebDescription: Woman's pale blue satin cap, with couched gold thread embroidery, and a gold thread tassel. This cap is one item from a well-made fashionable five-piece outfit for a wealthy woman, for wearing at parties or court occasions.

Description: bolero of pale blue satin, with gold thread embroidery and blue beads. Sleeveless. Front buttoning. Part of a five part woman's outfit, A-E. Ulrike al-Khamis (NMS) 29/9/2005: see hat (B).
WebDescription: This sleeveless waistcoat or bolero is made of pale blue satin, with gold thread embroidery and blue beads. It buttons down the front, with gold thread buttons and looped braid. It is part of a five-piece woman's outfit, for grand occasions.

Description: pale blue satin jacket with gold thread embroidery. Sleeves button down along arms, can be worn loose. Part of a five part woman's outfit, A-E. See comments by Ulrike al-Khamis for B & C. Formal garment set for a lady, very well to do. Interesting cut, th
WebDescription: Shown here with the matching trousers and waistcoat is the woman's jacket of pale blue satin, with heavy gold thread embroidery. The jacket has a rounded neck, and the underarms are not seamed for ease of movement, instead they can be buttoned up with gold thread buttons and loops. This is part of a well-made fashionable five-piece outfit for a wealthy woman.

Description: one of a pair of shoes, part of a woman's outfit, A-F. Pale blue satin court shoes with gold thread trim. Louis heel. White kid skin lining. Size 5 1/2. Fabric worn and discoloured. Underside of sole stamped with figures '53' and 'L60'. Size written insid
WebDescription: This pair of shoes matches the rest of the outfit for a wealthy woman. They are pale blue satin covered court shoes with gold thread embroidery, and some tiny blue glass beads.  The satin is slightly worn and discoloured. The shoes have Louis heels and white kid skin linings. The size, 5 1/2,  is written in black ink inside, together with some other numbers. The underside of the leather soles have been stamped with the figures '53' and 'L60'.  At the end of the nineteenth century it was not unusual for European shoe forms to be imported and re-covered in Turkey.

Description: robe of gilt on scarlet red brocade, with cream cotton lining. Gilt braid and metal thread toggles and loops for fastening on upper length of centre front opening. Close inspection with Ulrike al-Khamis (NMS) 29/9/2005: revealed several stamps on cotton l
WebDescription: This gilt and red silk brocade robe is the outer layer of a matching outfit, which would have been luxury wear for a wealthy merchant or townsman. The fabric was imported, probably from France, and the costume made up by a tailor in Fez. The couched gold braid ornament and padded button and loop fastenings are impressive. The cotton lining has stamps from the manufacturer confirming that it is superior Manchester calico, and a printed image of the Tower Bridge which was very popular as a symbol of Britain when it first opened in 1898.

Description: waistcoat belonging to scarlet and yellow man's costume (A-J). Opens centre front, gilt braid ribbon edging down upper front and round false pockets. Gilt thread embroidery with loop and toggle fastenings also on upper front. Orange silk lining.
WebDescription: The waistcoat from the wealthy man's outift is made of the same red and gold silk brocade as the outer robe, with similar couched silk and gilt thread decoration and fastenings. The lining here is of orange cotton, with some pale blue silk appearing in the uncut pocket openings.

Description: blue satin trousers with elasticated top, very full legs. Edged with metallic thread. Repaired.
WebDescription: The trousers in the wealthy man's outfit are of pale blue silk, now quite crumpled, with gilt braid at the ankles and waistband. The waist is gathered by a tie string inside a casing. The gusset is very baggy, for ease of movement, whilst the ankles are quite trim.

Description: long Kashmir coat from Pakistan with tambour work and wool embroidery. Fastens centre front. Width measured at hem.
WebDescription: This long robe or coat from Kashmir would be worn by a man. It is made of cream wool cloth with chain and plain stitch embroidered floral designs in orange, brown and green coloured wool threads. The robe has an upright collar, tapering sleeves and a gathered skirt. It fastens down the centre front, with toggle and loop fastenings.

Description: black and red silk tunic with round neck and short sleeves with mirror embroidery in green, yellow, natural, red and orange. Slashed shoulders with loop and button fastening. Metallic braid around hem. Width at hem 772 mm.
WebDescription: This woman's tunic of black and red silk came with an almost matching pair of trousers. The tunic has a round neck and short sleeves. The slashed shoulders have loop and button fastenings. Across the chest and shoulders is a broad lobe and smaller panels densely embroidered with tiny mirrors, none as shisha work, in green, yellow, natural, red and orange silks, repeated to form a diagonal lattice and floral designs. A much coarser metallic braid has been added later round the hem and in the area of the false side pockets. Below the embroidered areas the silk has been tie-dyed with hundreds of tiny points. The tunic is very worn and has been patched from the rear in places.

Description: pair of very voluminous navy blue silk trousers. Geometric motifs embroidered around legs in green, yellow, red, black and white, and mirror work. All over embroidered spot motifs in red and white silk, and yellow and green. Top casting for drawstring. Co
WebDescription: These voluminous navy blue silk trousers were collected with the tunic and may have been worn together by the same young woman or girl. In place of the tiny tie-dye dots on the tunic the upper area of the trousers are covered all over with embroidered spot motifs in red and white silk, with some yellow and green. The trousers have a casing at the waist to take a drawstring. The ankle areas are densely embroidered with geometric motifs embroidered in green, yellow, red, black and white silk thread, and mirror work.

Description: off-white gauze shadow striped blouse. Full sleeves shaped by gathers at elbows. Sleeves, neck and front opening edged with cream silk and gilt thread pyramids. Embroidered with cream silk, yellow and gilt scrolls and leaves. Unprovenanced, possibly or Ea
WebDescription: This ladies blouse or shirt is made from silk with alternating stripes of solid off-white silk and shadow or transparent gauze silk. The full length sleeves are shaped by gathers at the elbows. The sleeves, neck and front opening are edged with cream silk and gilt thread pyramids. The front and sleeve ends are also embroidered with scrolls and leaves in cream and yellow silk, gilt threads.

Description: strip of 19th century material, embossed velvet. Tinsel thread woven in. Very poor condition but the loss of most of the floral design allows one to see the drawn pattern outline underneath.
WebDescription: This remnant strip of a once fine silk velvet brocade has survived for over a hundred years. The flower head design has some foil or tinsel wrapped threaeds woven in. Now that much of this has worn away one can see the pattern outline drawn directly onto the base fabric surface.

Description: electric blue material, decorated in coarse embroidery - birds, butterflies and flowers, in green, cerise, white, black and gold thread. 20th century.
WebDescription: This length of bright blue silk has been machine embroidered with designs of  birds, butterflies and flowers, in green, cerise, white, black and gold thread. The designs are arranged in the strips and curves that would need to be cut up and sewn onto a woman's robe for ornament.

Description: Black velvet oval cloth embroidered with thick gold and silverwire. Said to be "piece of Mecca Holy Carpet, given to donor by Hussein, King of Hejas (Arabia) in 1917". Correct title of donor would now be 'Sharif of Hijaz' (Ulrike al-Khamis, NMS 29/9/2005)
WebDescription:
This cloth is a holy souvenir, one of many pieces cut from the cloth that covers the sacred Kaa'ba, the central shrine at Mecca. The Kaa'ba cloth used to be cut up and given away each year. The cloth is made of black velvet, which may be a wool and cotton mixture. The calligraphy is embroidered with gold wire thread raised with cotton wadding. The piece is lined with cream cotton. This piece was given to the donor's husband by "Hussein, King of Hejas (Arabia) in 1917". The correct title would now be given as 'Sharif of Hijaz'. 
At the time the Ka'aba cloth was embroidered in Cairo, probably in a dedicated workshop or factory. The Mamluke rulers of Egypt had been sending this special cloth to Mecca every year since the second half of the 13th century, as part of their annual Hajj pilgrimage caravan. The Arabic reads: Maalik Oyoum or Master of the Day, which is part of a longer phrase in praise of Allah as Master of the Day of Judgement.

Description: oblong cloth of hand woven linen with fine and coarse weft threads alternating in bands of three and twelve threads each. The ends are embroidered with a row of buildings in cream silk and heavy metal lame thread. Tarnished, some stains. Early 19th centur
WebDescription: This decorative cover cloth of hand woven linen has fine and coarse weft threads alternating in bands of three and twelve threads each. The ends are embroidered with a row of buildings in cream silk and heavy gilt metal lame thread. Some of the metal threads are now tarnished and the linen stained, but when it was new the gold or gilt threadwork would have been stunning and brilliant.

Description: panel of deep tangerine / red satin with three sides boardered with braid, a band of cream satin worked with flowers and leaves in shades of blue and gilt and an outer band of black satin. The panel is embroidered with flowers, butterflies, bats (a symbol
WebDescription: Silk hanging with a young man riding a lion or unicorn, accompanied by a servant carrying a gift and children with food and flowers, a scene appropriate for New Year celebrations.

Description: piece of Chinese embroidery, before being appliqued to a piece of material or a garment. Attached to double sheet of paper. In green, blue, yellow and gold thread. Floral design.
WebDescription: This elaborate flower vase motif was made in a workshop or small factory to be applied later to a Chinese woman's robe or other garment. The embroidery is done in green, blue and yellow silks using satin stitch with some couched gold thread. It has been temporarily stitched to a double sheet of paper.

Description: Silk brocade hanging, rather than a pair of curtains as originally described. Patterned with large gold rondels with pairs of phoenix or ho-ho birds, against a diaper of octogans and plainer flower heads. Dark blue/brown ground. Blue lining. Other colour
WebDescription: This very luxurious silk brocade hanging has a design in dark blue, red, and two shades of gold thread. The pattern is a regular repeat of large gold rondels with pairs of phoenix or ho-ho birds, against a diaper of octogans and plainer flower heads. The phoenix is a very sacred lucky symbol in Japan, and the cloth was probably made for a temple or for a rich lord's home or castle.

Description: quilted jacket of figured brown satin design of varie-coloured chrysanthemums. Kimono sleeves. Fastened with three silk 'frogs'. Originally described as Chinese, but bought in Kuala Lumper and Malaysian in style. Width at hem 560 mm.
WebDescription: This quilted jacket with a stand-up collar has been made from an imported Chinese satin with a woven design of varie-coloured chrysanthemums. The sleeves narrow to the wrists. It is fastened with three silk 'frogs'.

Description: robe or coat of gold/yellow silk colour, fully lined with bright blue silk. Richly embroidered, has design of multicoloured bats on broad sleeve cuffs. Faded.
WebDescription: This woman's robe or coat is made of golden yellow silk damask, lined with a bright blue silk. It is richly embroidered in varie-coloured silks with flowers, butterflies and fruit bowls. The neck or collar, the bottom front opening and the side slits are edged with two woven silk braids, a narrower braid with pale blue flowers on white, and a deeper blue and white on black braid with a repeated pattern of blue clouds and large white circles or rondels with cranes. The cuffs are decorated differently with a broad cream silk band with a design of multicoloured bats.

Description: long silk robe, red with yellow lining, heavy high quality embroidery of cranes, a symbol of long life. The cranes are in a variety of flying designs. The black brocade at the neck line, cuffs and hem has a repeat design of butterflies. Butterflies like b
WebDescription: This woman's robe of bright red silk is embroidered all over with cranes in satin stitch.  Several different versions of the same crane design are used to add vareity. The braid broder has purple butterflies on a black ground. Cranes are a symbol of long life and wisdom in China.

Description: purple/black silk jacket with pink, turquoise piping and embroidered and brocade panels. Large cuffs with detailed bird and flower embroidery. Applique braid curls in two clusters on jacket front. Embroidered bird and flower panels lower body front, inclu
WebDescription: This woman's jacket or coat is a stunning contrast of a dark purple silk body and pale pink trimmings. It has elaborate applique border bands with cut silhouette designs of curls and leaves, and deep sleeve cuffs with embroidered designs of phoenixes and flowers. It forms an almost matching set with the richly embroidered skirt.

Description: skirt with light mauve pleats with lavish embroidered panels of birds and flowers on a gold background, centre front and  back. White cotton waistband.
WebDescription: This woman's silk skirt probably forms a matching set with the jacket (F.1989.0014.0159A). The pleated pink silk of the main body is a slightly deeper colour, but this could be due to less light damage.  The  silk braid is slightly different, and there is much more couched gold thread embroidery in the central bird and flower panel.

Description: bright blue silk dragon robe or jacket, with lighter blue silk lining. Heavily embroidered in bright colours with gold thread embroidered dragons scattered over material. Finely stitched pekin stitch Buddhist motifs. Horse shoe shaped cuffs in darker blue
WebDescription: This shorter dragon robe was probably made for a young man. It is made of bright blue silk embroidered with many different coloured silks and eight couched gold thread dragons. The other traditional motifs include peony flower heads, a central mountain peak, waves, clouds, bats and Buddhist symbols such as eternal knots, conch shells and vases of flowers. These are embroidered using satin stitch and some Peking knot stitches. The horse shoe shaped cuffs are made of a darker blue silk, as are the neck and side front closing bang. The robe has finely cast gilt brass buttons with an openwork design.

Description: kimono, probably a uchikake or wedding kimono for a woman. Cream silk with woven damask pattern in interlacing bands. Stylized cloud shapes printed on top of garment, outlined with gold thread, water patterns on lower half, outlined with silver thread. Fl
WebDescription: This kimono is one of several that would be worn by a woman on her wedding day. It is an over-kimono known as an uchikake, of embroidered silk damask. The pearly white damask gives a fretwork ground design, on which are hand-painted resist paste water spirals and cloud outlines, and a green hill mound sprinkled with tiny flecks of mica or glitter. The other designs, most clear on the back of the robe, are of clouds, a large crane and a hairy tailed tortoise. These are embroidered in coloured silks with details in couched gold thread. Both the crane and tortoise are symbols of longevity. The lining is brilliant scarlet silk, padded with cotton wadding at the hem.

Description: woman's kimono of cream silk with woven damask pattern of leaves and flowers and printed or painted pattern of groups of leaves and flowering branches, picked out in coloured embroidery and gold thread. Several cranes embroidered on back sleeves and body
WebDescription: This long-sleeved over-kimono or uchikake would be worn by a woman on her wedding day, or for a court or theatre visit. The cream silk woven damask ground has a pattern of leaves and flowers, overprinted or painted with groups of leaves and flowering branches. Details of these are picked out in coloured silk thread embroidery with some couched gold thread. Several cranes are embroidered on the sleeves and body, and the robe's back also features a turtle with a plumed or hairy tail.  Both the crane and tortoise or turtle are symbols of long life.

Description: man's robe or short coat, 19th century? Thin silk, narrow woven, vertical stripes in dull brown and green. Brown silk lining. Backed throughout with thin layer of wadding, brown silklining. Cut in 'T' shape, as for kimono, but 3/4 length. Small circles of
WebDescription: This formal man's robe or jacket of striped silk is known as a haori. The narrow dark-striped outer fabric is lined with brown silk inside. Five moon or family crest emblems made of printed paper are glued on at the shoulders, centre back and top of the sleeves. This particular moon has a design of curled leaves.

Description: woman's green embroidered velvet spencer or jacket. The material is from another garment, probably 18th century. The embroidery is carried out in silver thread and spangles. The lining is coarse, hand woven linen. Date c. 1806-7. Width at hem 382 mm.
WebDescription: This woman's green silk velvet spencer or jacket may have been made up with fabric from another earlier garment. It is embroidered with narrow silver and gold thread, silver, gold and pink folded foil and spangles or sequins in a floral design. The lining is a coarse, hand woven linen.

Description: waistcoat with chain stitch embroidery including a variety of Arabic calligraphy.  Black wool cloth with gilt thread and green, cerise, blue and cream. Ulrike al-Khamis (NMS) 29/9/2005: definitely from Turkey, where the repeated short calligraphy phrases
WebDescription: Black wool cloth waistcoat for a young man or boy with chain stitch embroidery in coloured silks including stylised Arabic calligraphy and complex buta leaf shapes.

Description: waistcoat with chain stitch embroidery including a variety of Arabic calligraphy.  Black wool cloth with gilt thread and green, cerise, blue and cream. Ulrike al-Khamis (NMS) 29/9/2005: definitely from Turkey, where the repeated short calligraphy phrases
WebDescription:
Best dress black wool cloth waistcoat for a young man or boy with chain stitch embroidery in coloured silks featuring stylised Arabic calligraphy and complex buta leaf shapes. 
Transferred from Worthing Museum and Art Gallery, 1989. Given to them by Mr Honeybourne, 1962

Description: loose woven robe in natural coloured cotton. Sleeveless; open from neck to below waist at centre. Heavily embroidered panel - gold thread and sequins. For a woman?
WebDescription: This sleeveless cotton robe is loosely woven, and may have been worn by a woman relaxing after a bath. Around the long neck panel the front is heavily decorated with silk thread embroidery and sequins forming a floral design.

Description: shot and embossed (rather than quilted) pink silk Persian or Iranian robe. High collar stiffened with lines of hand stitching in yellow silk, open down centre front with single cord toggle (loop missing). Full length sleeves opening over lower arm with tw
WebDescription: This man's robe is made from shot and embossed pink silk with a high collar stiffened with lines of hand stitching in yellow silk. The centre front opening fastens with a single cord toggle (the loop is now missing). The full length sleeves are open at their lower seams, fastening there with twelve toggle and loop fastenings. The side seams are open from the hip down. The robe is lined with a woven red wool or brushed cotton cloth. It came with a separate woven fabric belt.

Description: cloth bag, with heavy embroidery worked in gold and silver thread, including Arabic characters. Drawstring top, gilt wire thread through bone rings. Lined with cream cotton. Mainly brown and grey with gold and silver. Some loose threads. Ulrike al-Khamis
WebDescription: This small cloth bag is heavily embroidered with gold and silver threads on a brown and grey ground. The design includes phrases of Arabic pseudo-calligraphy, which have become so abstract that they are no longer decipherable. The crescent and star motifs are also prominent. These are national symbols in Turkey where this type of embroidery was very popular at the end of the 19th and beginning of the 20th centuries.The bag has a drawstring top, with gilt wire threaded through bone rings. It is lined with cream cotton.

Description: cloth bag, similar colouring to F.1989.14.192, but smaller. Exterior drawstring at neck. Gilt, brown, and grey threads, including quasi-Arabic script and tughra or signature in cartouche in centre. Lined with mauve sateen. Scalloped crochet edging. Ulrike
WebDescription: This cloth bag is similar in style to F.1989.14.192, but smaller. The embroidery is done in gilt, brown, orange and blue threads. The pseudo or quasi-Arabic script is even more abstract. It does include a tughra or signature in a cartouche in the centre. The bag closes with an exterior drawstring at the neck ending in tassels on either side. It has a scalloped crocheted edging and is lined with mauve sateen.

Description: thick ivory bracelet or anklet, probably for a man. Lovely golden cream colour inside.
WebDescription: Oval ivory bracelet with paler cream colour on the outside and deep orange patina on the inside, produced by many years of use and wear.

Description: part of a boy's costume, A-C. Jacket of mauve silk embroidered with sprays of flowers (with a brocade border). Lined with printed cotton. Lovely butterfly shaped cord and tassel ornament. Width at hem 378 mm.
WebDescription: This boy's costume includes a jacket, trousers and a festival headdress. Both boys and girls wear bright red and pink in China, for celebrations. The jacket is deep pink or mauve silk with machine embroidered flower sprays, and a lovely braided silk butterfly ornament. The ribbon edged collar ends in curled cuts. Machine woven braid edges the sleeves, front opening and hem. The cotton lining has a printed floral design very typical of 1950s designs.

Description: part of a boy's costume, A-C. Trousers which wrap around (inside leg open) with 2 loops for fastening at waist. Lined with printed cotton, with printed cotton waistband. Machine embroidered floral sprays on lower legs. Blue braid on ankles. Width measured
WebDescription: The matching trousers in the boys costume have a deep printed cotton waist band. They are split in the centre, for easy toilettting.  The cotton lining is a floral print of slightly different design to that lining the jacket.

Description: part of a boy's costume, A-C. Round skull-shaped hat decorated with stiff pieces of material, tassels, pompoms, beads, etc. Original provenance possibly Thai, more likely to be Chinese festival outfit, probably for a girl rather than a boy.
WebDescription: This festival headdress belongs with the boy's jacket and trouser outfit, though it may originally have been made for a girl. The core is a round skull-shaped hat of silk stiffened with card and lined with printed cotton. The elaborate decoration includes cut curls, flaps, coiled wire, paste jewels, beads, tassels and pompoms.

Description: part of a boy's costume, A-C. Round skull-shaped hat decorated with stiff pieces of material, tassels, pompoms, beads, etc. Original provenance possibly Thai, more likely to be Chinese festival outfit, probably for a girl rather than a boy.
WebDescription:
Young children often imitate well to do adults in their best dress. This headdress with its elaborate paste jewels, tassels and pompom ornaments is appropriate for New Year celebrations. 
Transferred from Worthing Museum and Art Gallery, 1989. Given to them by Mr D L Sheldon, 1965

Description: bright orange brocade silk skirt, embroidered. Two panels on cotton basque. Front and back identical. Centre pleated, each pleat edged with black. Bands of embroidery in blue on outside, sprays of flowers in natural colours on inside of pleat. On right si
WebDescription: This bright orange silk brocade skirt is heavily pleated and has two richly embroidered panels, one centre front, and the other centre back. They are filled with peonies and other flowers. The panels, pleats and hem are edged with embroidered braid with blue flowers on a black ground. The deep waist band is a plain white cotton.

Description: short robe or coat in blue brocaded silk with bands of blue embroidery as on skirt. Fastens at neck with four blue enamelled buttons. Wide on outside with flowers and butterflies. Sleeves lined with pink silk edged with blue embroidery. Robe or coat lined
WebDescription: The short robe or coat that goes with the pleated skit is of blue silk brocade with similar bands or braids of blue embroidery. The coat fastens at the neck with four blue enamelled buttons. The sleeves are lined with pink silk, whilst the main body of the robe is lined with plain blue silk. The yellow silk cuffs are embroidered with peonies and butterflies that echo the pattern on the skirt panels.

Description: female doll with lace top and fruit basket on her head. Basket with mixed fruit and pineapple. Black fringe and red head scarf, brown felt face and body. Beaded earrings and necklace, pale brown lace top. Blue and red striped satin skirt, plaid satin scar
WebDescription: This doll carrying a fruit basket on her head wears a cotton lace top, and a striped satin skirt with a plaid satin scarf tied round it. She has lots of gold ornaments and a white cotton petticoat with lace trim. Her label says Bonecas Tipicas.

Description: male doll in striped poncho and cap, with silver roll in right hand. Striped crochet hat and knitted face, with wire arms wound with wool. Striped woven poncho and striped woven shoulder bag. Silver roll in hand tied with coloured threads. Black cotton kn
WebDescription: Male doll in striped poncho and cap, with a silver roll in his right hand, probably representing a flute. His face and body are knitted, the arms made of wire wound with wool. He carries a woven shoulder bag and wears black cotton knee breeches and white knitted stockings. His cardboard shoes are tied on with black thread.

Description: female doll in striped skirt, with baby in cap. Baby in red crocheted cap wrapped in pink fabric, and with a fabric face. Woman with black hat and black head scarf, and a fabric face and wire arms. Striped cotton shawl holding baby in place. Red and black
WebDescription: Female doll in a striped skirt, carrying a baby behind her head. The baby has a red crocheted cap and the woman a black hat and long shawl or headscarf. Both have painted pink fabric faces and wire arms. The woman wears a red and black knitted bodice and a striped cotton skirt and carries a spindel in her left hand. She has a blue cotton petticoat and white knitted stockings. Her cardboard sandels are tied on with black thread.

Description: male and female riding a black horse. Man with black paper hat, painted clay head and padded cloth body. Cream and black felt jacket with black tassels on cuffs and front. Cream cotton shirt with net front, red waistband, black trousers, painted black clo
WebDescription: Flamenco dancers riding a black horse, a popular souvenir ornament from Spain. The lady wears a yellow silk dress with layers of ruffles or flounces, and the man wears tight black trousers and a brimmed black hat. Their faces are made from painted clay. The horse is plastic with a velour fur coat.

Description: factory printed cotton. Brown, green and white with design of zebras head in circles. Zebra heads green and white, on brown ground. Most of cloth background brown. Two circles on this piece of cloth. Printed along selvedge "JAVA BY DAVID WHITEHEAD ZIMBABW
WebDescription: This modern factory printed cotton was made for sale to women for wearing as a cloth wrap. The main motifs of the brown, green and white design are large zebra heads in circles. Printed along the selvedge is: JAVA BY DAVID WHITEHEAD ZIMBABWE 9372". The David Whitehead firm is owned by Lonrho, and is one of the major textile groups in Zimbabwe.

Description: cotton factory print. Chess-board pattern of dull brick red and black/green squares, with flying birds that covere 3 x 2 squares in lines of green/brown and white/brown. Printed along selvedge: "A GENUINE CONE JAVA PRINT". Cone textiles is another textile
WebDescription: This modern factory printed cotton was made for sale to women for wearing as a cloth wrap. A chess-board pattern of dull red and black/green squares is interrupted with repeats of a flying bird. Printed along the selvedge is: 'A GENUINE CONE JAVA PRINT". Cone textiles are another textile manufacturer in Zimbabwe, lower quality and price than David Whitehead (see F.1990.0004.0002)

Description: cotton factory print. White background with light brown 'crackle' and pattern in very dark blue and golden yellow. Alternating rope (A) and diagonal (B) pattern bands running in warp direction. 4.A rope colours white and yellow pattern on dark blue/black
WebDescription: This is the largest of a series of cotton cloth samples that were purchased to show the colour variations produced for one particular factory print.
